author: frederickbangs
title: My first post on steemit
body:
Hello world,
I never knew there was a platform that rewarded people for creating contents since I am conversant with medium and reddit, but I do not get rewards for writng except that I gain a lot from reading posts from others as well as writing post. Reading and writing is part of me so majority of my time goes there but on weekends, I always spend my time farming.

![20200221_121934.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmU9dy54e5iv5iRu6EyQfcaTjZnRHf52Syjm7FbiPiwDLX/20200221_121934.jpg)
A picture of a segment of my poultry cage
 
 I never knew about steem/steemit until I saw a tweet from Justin Sun of tron. I did my research and waited for AMA video the following day, which was where I started to understand the basics of steemit. I got to know about community building and I loved in. Before I joined the community, I found a few community that looked interesting and which I would love to join after reading about them which are @project.hope #ocd #globalimpact #steemleo. I found some amazing things about thes

author: frederickbangs
title: The Science Of Event Marketing (The Sugar that Calls the Ant to Fest)
body:
Have you tried to organize a program or an event, only to have yourself and your crew attend it? It can be very frustrating after spending enough time to plan the event as well as spending money to get the program fixed. You ask yourself, what did I do wrong? Event planning (Check), good team (check), idea (check), so what could have possibly gone wrong? Marketing went wrong.


![20200222_113112.png](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmQM5xzUop6n24gYPPqTTiPw9AxZ9Z7sxouhqKZzibXzcr/20200222_113112.png)
*pinterest*

Marketing is a major key to sales in any enterprise, business, and firm, not leaving the fact that marketing also cut across humans (“the way you dress is the way you are addressed” is a marketing word). With all this said, even events need marketing since it involves consuming a service.

Marketing events unlike other business marketing is very difficult because it involves buyers giving their time to attend your event and at such expect major satisfaction that will last for a very long time. This sat
root_title: The Science Of Event Marketing (The Sugar that Calls the Ant to Fest)

author: frederickbangs
title: The Investors, The Employees, The Customers; Who is more Important to a Business?
body:
In a business, there are three sets of people that makes things go around. From the origin of business, its activities, profit, loss, growth and sustainability depends on them. In this case, A business require three set of people to keep running as well as growing and these people are the investors, the employees, and the customers. These people keep the circle of business going round and they are very vital to any business at all.


![960x0 (1).jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmabiayorh8XntmkG82fs3cnFnjQirx9zEbrs9dakG5Wj7/960x0%20(1).jpg)
[Credit](https://www.forbes.com/sites/quora/2017/12/14/who-is-more-important-to-a-company-its-customers-or-its-employees/amp/)

### Simple Definition
Definitely, Investors are people who believe in your ideas, plans, goals and designs and have decided to put in their funds to make your ideas become reality. They expect returns for their money and in most cases they lose their money if the company goes bankrupt.

Employees are the ones who have to sacrifice their time,
root_title: The Investors, The Employees, The Customers; Who is more Important to a Business?
